tagline: CMask source, pre-compiled binary distributions, and install scripts
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
body:
### Mac Installation - Automagic

To install cmask on your mac system, just hit up our automagical script. Open Terminal (found in /Applications/Utilities) and copy paste the following command:

    curl http://cloud.github.com/download/utems/cmask/cmask-install.sh | sh

This will figure out if your machine is capable of compiling from source or if it should just download the pre-compiled binaries. Then it will install them in /usr/local/bin and add it to your path. Voila!


### Original Readme

written by Andre Bartetzki <andre@bartetzki.de>

This software is published under GPL terms, see file LICENSE.txt.

This is software with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY.
Use it at your OWN RISK. 

for manual, examples, old binaries etc. see
http://www.bartetzki.de/de/software.html

To recompile:
    cd to the source/ directory.
        make
name: CMask
